newsitem.title: MOROCCO: Morocco's steel firm cuts losses.
newsitem.headline: Morocco's steel firm cuts losses.

text.p: Morocco's Longometal Afrique firm, which imports and markets steel and building material said on Tuesday it had cut losses to 7.4 million dirhams ($0.8 million) in 1996 from 30.9 million dirhams ($3.35 million) the year before.
A spokesman for the firm said: "We have already reduced the biggest share of losses and we expect to get out of the red by end 1997."

ABN-AMRO Finance brokerage said in a recent report that the company's deficit was attributed to heavy debts following big investments in steel and building sectors and a badly-controlled diversification strategy.
Turnover for 1996 was 399.7 million dirhams from 284 million dirhams in 1995.
The stock last traded at 287 dirhams on March 31.
